<C> TX of Primary Tumor </C> <E> means the Primary tumor cannot be assessed </E>.
<C> Tis of Primary Tumor </C> <E> means Carcinoma in situ </E>.
<C> T1 of the Supraglottis </C> <E> means Tumor limited to one subsite of the supraglottis with normal vocal cord mobility </E>.
<C> T2 of the Supraglottis </C> <E> means Tumor invades mucosa of more than one adjacent subsite of the supraglottis or glottis or region outside the supraglottis without fixation of the larynx </E>.

<C> T3 of the Supraglottis </C> <E> means Tumor limited to the larynx with vocal cord fixation and/or invades the postcricoid area, preepiglottic space, paraglottic space, and/or inner cortex of the thyroid cartilage </E>.
<C> T4 of the Supraglottis </C> <E> means Moderately advanced or very advanced local disease </E>.
<C> T4a of T4 of the Supraglottis </C> <E> means Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades through the outer cortex of the thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx </E>.
<C> T4b of T4 of the Supraglottis </C> <E> means Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades the prevertebral space, encases the carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures </E>.
<C> T1 of the Glottis </C> <E> means Tumor limited to the vocal cord(s) with normal mobility </E>.
<C> T1a of T1 of the Glottis </C> <E> means Tumor limited to one vocal cord </E>.
<C> T1b of T1 of the Glottis </C> <E> means Tumor involves both vocal cords </E>.
<C> T2 of the Glottis </C> <E> means Tumor extends to the supraglottis and/or subglottis, and/or with impaired vocal cord mobility </E>.
<C> T3 of the Glottis </C> <E> means Tumor limited to the larynx with vocal cord fixation and/or invasion of the paraglottic space and/or inner cortex of the thyroid cartilage </E>.
<C> T4 of the Glottis </C> <E> means Moderately advanced or very advanced local disease </E>.
<C> T4a of T4 of the Glottis </C> <E> means Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades through the outer cortex of the thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx </E>.
<C> T4b of T4 of the Glottis </C> <E> means Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades the prevertebral space, encases the carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures </E>.
<C> T1 of the Subglottis </C> <E> means Tumor limited to the subglottis </E>.
<C> T2 of the Subglottis </C> <E> means Tumor extends to the vocal cords with normal or impaired mobility </E>.
<C> T3 of the Subglottis </C> <E> means Tumor limited to the larynx with vocal cord fixation and/or inner cortex of the thyroid cartilage </E>.
<C> T4 of the Subglottis </C> <E> means Moderately advanced or very advanced local disease </E>.
<C> T4a of T4 of the Subglottis </C> <E> means Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades cricoid or thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx </E>.
<C> T4b of T4 of the Subglottis </C> <E> means Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades the prevertebral space, encases the carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures </E>.
